snippet: The best way to successfully respond to hate, even from the likes of ISIS, is to step outside the logic of vengeance.
abstract: David Brooks Op-Ed column holds that worst way to respond to assailants, whether in relatively safe world of Internet comments or in dangerous realm of international terrorism, is to match them with equal amounts of ego-driven violence; advocates rising above vicious cycle and looking at bigger picture; contends that many of history's most admired figures are those who have broken chain of attack and counterattack.
lead_paragraph: The best way to successfully respond to hate, even from the likes of ISIS, is to step outside the logic of vengeance.
